page.title: 19TOURISM IN KIRKBY LONSDALE
page.content: Tourism has increased rapidly in the Kirkby Lonsdale area in the last 15-20 years.This is largly attributed to the fact that people have more{leisure {time}but also because of increased mobility, as the majority who visit the area do so in their own cars.Interestingly, steep rise in {petrol prices}in the 1970s may have encouraged tourism as more people started visiting places nearer their own homes.The most popular places visited are{Devils Bridge, St. Mary's {Church}and{Ruskin's View.}The only major problem created by tourism is {parking}and no real solution seems possible.Some residents feel that if tourism is going to be developed, then more{leisure facilities}must be created to encourage them to come and stay.Increased publicity may be needed to stimulate tourism even more.
